channel.title: XBox Kinect
channel.description: what do you think of it? wouldn't you much rather just relax with some Cheetos and a controller and kill enemies, than have to rely on our lazy bodies and poor balance?

item.title: XBox Kinect
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:17, topic:368172”]Using your body and using a Wii remote are 2 completely different things. Microsoft is not copying them all, besides the concept of actually MOVING to play games.

Wii uses a remote (only your arm), Kinect judges your body movements and voice (full body). How the hell are those the same?

I haven’t tried out Kinect myself, but I love the concept.[/quote]
i agree. b4 it came out i looked at the commercials and was like wow if it works that good wow. i havent tried it yet but im guessing they used there “magic” to make it awesome in the advertisments. when i first saw it i though Iron Man! and was like our tech is getting closer, all we need now is holographics/grams, so i have a greater chance of becoming tony stark! lol dont criticize my dream. lol but this technology i think may have a chance as a computer input method.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox Kinect
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:16, topic:368172”]Oh… I found it:

[quote]It seems to me that it would be obvious that any camera-based tracking technology is going to require some minimum level of contrast in order to function reliably.

Sorry black people, no offense, but you’re going to have to wait for some future technological improvement if you want to use things like this. [/quote][/quote]
l0l

item.title: XBox Kinect
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Playstation had it first

en.wikipedia.org

EyeToy

The EyeToy is a color digital camera device, similar to a webcam, for the PlayStation 2. The technology uses computer vision and gesture recognition to process images taken by the camera. This allows players to interact with games using motion, color detection and also sound, through its built-in microphone. It was released in October 2003. The camera is manufactured by Logitech (known as "Logicool" in Japan), although newer EyeToys are manufactured by Namtai. The camera is mainly used for playin...

Read full topic

item.title: XBox Kinect
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Using your body and using a Wii remote are 2 completely different things. Microsoft is not copying them all, besides the concept of actually MOVING to play games.

Wii uses a remote (only your arm), Kinect judges your body movements and voice (full body). How the hell are those the same?

I haven’t tried out Kinect myself, but I love the concept.

Read full topic

item.title: XBox Kinect
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Oh… I found it:

It seems to me that it would be obvious that any camera-based tracking technology is going to require some minimum level of contrast in order to function reliably.

Sorry black people, no offense, but you’re going to have to wait for some future technological improvement if you want to use things like this.

Read full topic
